option.name: NSXT-IP
option.description: Please Enter the NSX-TManager IP address
option.label: NSX-T Manager IP

option.name: nsx_file
option.description: Enter deployment input data as Excel sheet file
option.label: NSX-T deployment Excel file

option.name: Compute-managers
option.description: Please use "New value" to add one or multiple vCenter servers IP adresses
option.label: Compute Managers

option.name: vCenter-password
option.description: Enter vCenter compute manager password (Note: The tool assumes the same password for all vCenters)
option.label: vCenter password

option.name: TEP_Pool_Gateways
option.description: Please enter (in CIDR format) the IP gateway for each TEP pool subnet you would like to add e.g. 172.31.12.1/25 or 192.168.10.254/24
option.label: NSX-T TEP pools gateways

option.name: Overlay-vlan
option.description:
Enter infra overlay Vlan id [0 - 4096]
**Note:** in case of shared Edge & compute cluster hosts, the Overlay Vlan on the Edge N-VDS should be different!
option.label: Overlay Vlan id

option.name: SharedCompute
option.description: In case the Edges are deployed in a shared compute cluster you need to use a different vlan id and subnet for Edge overlay traffic
option.label: Are you deploying the Edge VMs in a shared compute cluster?

option.name: EdgeOverlayVlan
option.description: In case of shared compute cluster with the Edges please enter overlay Vlan id for Edge VMs [0 - 4096]
option.label: Edge overlay Vlan id in case of shared compute cluser

option.name: EdgeOverlaySubnet
option.description: Please enter (in CIDR format) the IP gateway for the Edge TEP pool subnet in case of shared compute cluster with the Edges e.g. 172.31.12.1/25 or 192.168.10.254/24
option.label: Edge TEP pool gateway in case of shared compute cluser

option.name: ESXI-username
option.description: Optional, only needed if you would like to prep a single ESXI host instead of the whole vSphere cluster
option.label: Single ESXI username (Optional)

option.name: ESXI-password
option.description: Optional, only needed if you would like to prep a single ESXI host instead of the whole vSphere cluster
option.label: Single ESXI password (Optional)

option.name: edge_vm_root_password
option.description:
Choose the Edge VM users (root, audit and admin) password otherwise it will use the same as NSX-T Manager password
**Important note:** don't forget to configure the host/cluster hosting the edges with Trunk PG on their VDS, to be able to transport overlay and North-South peering Vlans.
option.label: Edge VM root password (Optional)

job.description:
**This workflow configures the Global fabric settings ex: Compute managers, TN profiles, nodes preparation, edges...**
**Assumptions:** * This job assumes the NSX-T Local Manager is already deployed. * Baremetal edge is not supported * MTU, LLDP/CDP and NIOC must be changed in VDS if using NSX with VDS7 (NSX teaming applies to NSX DvPGs only, VDS DvPG teaming still defined in vCenter) * For the VM Edges: * The hosting cluster/host uses VDS/VSS * The mgmt PG uses Active/Standby VDS uplinks * The Port groups for Overlay vlan and North-South Vlans are Trunked PG with Active/Standby uplinks
job.name: 01_Configure_Initial_NSXT_system
